channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: Canadian athletes on outside as Carney government's 1st budget sees no new sports funding
item.description: Canada’s summer and winter Olympians, along with other athletes, were left on the outside during Tuesday’s budget announcement by the federal government, despite a push in recent months by the Canadian Olympic Committee and national sport organizations for more resources.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Young people are facing a crisis of high unemployment. Here’s how the budget addresses that
item.description: Young people are facing high unemployment rates and struggling with a challenging labour market, and the government’s plan to address that includes more funding for summer job and work placement supports. But experts aren't sure that will be enough to alleviate the pressure of a challenging labour market.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Federal budget charts difficult path out of current crisis — with small margin of error
item.description: The 2025 federal budget plots a path for the Canadian economy to emerge from the current crisis. But it also highlights just how deep a hole the economy is in right now and how small the margin for error is as Canada navigates the perils of a trade war.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Governments Of Canada and Manitoba Strengthening Justice for Canada's First Responders
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Calgary's mayor cautiously optimistic about federal budget as more details sought
item.description: Mayor Jeromy Farkas said the budget makes funding for municipalities a priority, but notes Calgarians will judge the budget on 'actions on the ground, not words on paper.'
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Quebec government wants to restart talks with doctors over payment reform
item.description: Legault said Tuesday he wants to restart talks with doctors about the terms of his government's payment reform bill.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Budget promises to introduce framework for Canadian dollar-backed cryptocurrency
item.description: The Liberal government is committing to roll out new legislation to ensure some digital currencies are secure and stable enough for consumers and businesses to use.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Budget 2025: No commitment on emissions in Canada’s new climate strategy
item.description: The budget also doesn't mention possible incentive measures to encourage Canadians to lower their own emissions, such as reviving a subsidy for electric vehicle purchases.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Indigenous programs face $2.3B in cuts, some new money in Carney’s 1st budget
item.description: Indigenous programs face more than $2 billion in budget cuts but are being spared the worst of Ottawa’s proposed government-wide spending reductions in Mark Carney’s first budget as prime minister. In new money, Ottawa promises $2.3 billion over three years for safe water in First Nations.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Manitoba Government Expands Care for Dialysis Patients and Mothers in Norway House Cree Nation
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canada's immigration system is lost in the bushes
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Get Ready for Harper-Style Public Service Cuts, Says Analyst
item.description: Budget 2025 proposes cutting 40,000 government jobs.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: The Military Wins and Public Programs Lose in Carney’s Budget
item.description: But will the Liberals find enough support to survive a non-confidence vote?
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Budget ushers in 'transformational' era for federal public service
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Why should you care about the federal deficit?
item.description: The federal deficit is a common flashpoint in Canadian politics. Is it really such a big deal? And how much should you worry about it?
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Power outages, closures plague Westside Road as burned trees fall on power lines
item.description: 'The weekend of October 24th to 27th, the Wilson’s Landing and north area had power outages anywhere from 23 to 35 hours — all within a 54-hour period,' said resident Blanche Beda.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Andrew Rosenfeldt's aunt takes the stand during Day 11 of 2nd-degree murder trial
item.description: Rosenfeldt’s aunt said she heard a loud bang the night Nykera Brown died during the 11th day of his second-degree murder trial at Saskatoon Court of King's Bench Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Canola and food exports: What Budget 2025 proposes as trade war continues
item.description: The Liberal government is promising new supports for canola farmers and other sectors hit by U.S. and international tariffs in the federal budget released Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: St. Mary's fish plant destroyed by fire as crews face hurricane-force winds in N.L.
item.description: The fish plant in the Newfoundland community of St. Mary's has burned to the ground as the community faces hurricane force winds and heavy rain, Mayor Steve Ryan told CBC News Tuesday night.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: City of Kelowna hopes for provincial approval to ease restrictions on short-term rentals
item.description: Council also passed a resolution to try and lobby the province to fast-track the process and exemption as a final approval would not be granted until November 2026.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Waves could reach 12 metres high on N.L. south coast as heavy winds, rain persist
item.description: CBC meteorologist Ashley Brauweiler warns of a storm surge from the Burin Peninsula to the southern Avalon that could bring waves as high as 12 metres breaking along the shore.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: UCP brought back corporate donations to parties, then took in $471K in three months
item.description: Injury lawyers opened their wallets to support the United Conservative Party, while their fight against auto insurance reforms continues.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ontario town could soon own former WWII-era POW camp, but cost a concern
item.description: The future of Camp 30, a former prisoner of war camp in Ontario, is up in the air despite an offer for the municipality of Clarington to take on the remaining land and buildings.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Budget 2025: Ottawa to slash foreign aid spending to pre-pandemic levels
item.description: The budget talks of "leveraging innovative tools, while focusing support for countries that need it the most" and rejigging existing agreements with specific countries.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: The Beaches make a play for Canadian rock royalty at Doug Mitchell
item.description: The Beaches are making more than just waves.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Infants Bear the Brunt of RSV Hospitalizations, UBC Study Finds
item.description: Researchers say the province should do more to protect the very small and vulnerable.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Nova Scotia MP Chris d'Entremont resigns from Conservative caucus to join the Liberals
item.description: Nova Scotia MP Chris d'Entremont resigned from the Conservative caucus Tuesday — and he's joining the Liberals.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator
